refnamediv.refpurpose: C function which checks the number of input arguments present in the calling Scilab function.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: CheckInputArgument(void* pvCtx, int iMin, int iMax)

listitem.para: Scilab environment pointer, pass in "pvApiCtx" provided by api_scilab.h
the minimum number of input arguments which must be present in the calling Scilab function
the maximum number of input arguments which must be present in the calling Scilab function

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: C function which checks the number of input arguments present in the calling Scilab function. You must include api_scilab.h to benefit from this function.
If the number of arguments is not between _iMin and _iMax, we quit the C interface (return 0;) and an error is returned in the Scilab console.

Since CheckInputArgument is doing a return 0;
within the gateway function, it is important to call this function before any memory allocation in order to avoid any memory leak.
This function replaces the deprecated CheckLhs function

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: In this example, the C gateway function checks for a number of input arguments which must be between 2 and 3.
Now, some functions testing this interface:
refsection.programlisting: mycheckrhs(A,B); // OK, 2 input arguments mycheckrhs(A,B,C); // OK, 3 input arguments mycheckrhs(A); // ERROR, 1 input argument mycheckrhs(A,B,C,D); // ERROR, 4 input arguments
